notes.title: Le Présent (Regular -ER Verbs)
notes.explanation:
To conjugate regular -ER verbs (like 'parler' - to speak) in the present tense, remove the -ER ending from the infinitive and add the appropriate ending for the subject pronoun:
- je: -e
- tu: -es
- il/elle/on: -e
- nous: -ons
- vous: -ez
- ils/elles: -ent

notes.title: Gender of Nouns & Articles
notes.explanation: In French, all nouns have a grammatical gender: masculine or feminine. This affects the definite articles ('le' for masculine, 'la' for feminine, 'l'' before vowel/h, 'les' for plural) and indefinite articles ('un' for masculine, 'une' for feminine, 'des' for plural).
